Entry.1: 19/ Went into Bapaume sightseeing afternoon went in again on fatigue work filling into waters made by enemy.
Entry.2: Moved up next line camping in Big underground dugout.
Entry.3: Moved up to Bapaume camped in cellar.
Entry.4: Fatigue work in street filling up mine water.
Entry.5: Same as previous day late afternoon tried out of Bapaume and did sentry.
Entry.6: Relieved of road duty went up and camped in old house
Entry.7:
Fatigue on road saw great air fight five machine 
go
 brought to earth night time gas guard
Entry.8: Nothing doing in morning after noon moved up to Bancourt.
Entry.9:
Moved out at twelve o’clock for front line miserable cold day relieved 53rd Batt. Quiet night a few shells sent over by enemy.

Stayed in dug out all day relieved & night by 53rd Batt. No casualities in A Coy. marched back to Bancourt arrived about two in morning dead tired
Entry.11: Moved back to Bapaume to billets.
Entry.13: Moved up to front line again and relieved the 53rd Batt.
Entry.14: Ordinary trench duty went out early morning as covering party to Brigade machine gunners.
Entry.15: Advanced 800 yards night time bitterly cold
Entry.17:
Souvenier hunting relieved 53rd & night.

---6th

Had a days rest at Bapaume.
Entry.20: Moved out from Bapaume to Montabaun arrived there about six in afternoon
Entry.21: Had a day off so went to Albert bought tucker.
Entry.22: Got two days C.C. in morning for being A.W.L. usual drill afterwards
Entry.23: Squad drill morning had afternoon off answering whistle till light’s out
Entry.24: ANZAC. DAY Battalion had a days sport went to Albert afternoon
Entry.27: Went for a bath got a change of clothes morning afternoon fatigue mating sports ground
Entry.28: Brigade. Church parade morning Albury Camp afternoon went to Albert
Entry.29: Drill all day night time went to concert given by 5 Division Concert Party and Band very good
Entry.30: Went through ceremonial parade in morning and afternoon expecting Army Corps Commander polished up everything
Entry.31: Ceremonial parade and inspection by Brigadier General big General never turned up after parade got inoculated afternoon off.
Entry.32: Had a day off very sore arm from needle went to Albert in afternoon.
Entry.33: Marched to Frecourt had a look &
Entry.34:
Division Sports for a while 
got
 then went to Albert again

Saturday 5

Usual dull morning and afternoon.
Entry.35:
Church parade in Church Army Hut in morning

drill in afternoon miserable dusty day
Entry.36: Bayonet drill in morning D Company selected for Corps competition usual drill afternoon.
Entry.37: Rained all day lecture and loading rifle in morning got word get ready for line afternoon shortages again taken
Entry.38:
Moved out of Montauban in morning for line marched passed 
by
 General and Band along road

Arrived Bapaume early afternoon camped two hours between Bancourt and Fremicourt then moved a couple of miles camped in trench slept out in open all night get gas alarm during night.
Entry.39: Morning gas drill after practised extended order and charging a supposed enemy trench nightime rained
Entry.40:
Spelled all day left about eight o’clock for support

Trenches arrived about midnight took 
up
 over isolated post
Entry.41: Laid low all day fairly quiet
Entry.42:
Laid low enemy shelled very close for a while no casualities night 
re
 went back to ones underground aeroplanes reported enemy massing for attack.
Entry.43: Stood too ready for Fitz three heavy thunder lighting and rain nothing happened on our sector. Slept and rested all day
Entry.44:
Heavy bombardment on left early morning our sector quiet rested all day nightime went out on wiring party passed through ruined village of Lagincourt arrived back three o’clock

Wednesday
.
Entry.45: Rained during day nightime went out wiring party rained heavy miserable right finished one o’clock arrived back and shifted camp wandering and falling all over place came to new Dug outs daylight
Entry.46:
Slept and rested all day

nightime went out the same as previous night putting up barbed-wire. Friday 18

Rested all day nothing doing@ nightime
Entry.48: as day before enemy shelled very heavy on left & battery no work that night
Entry.49: Afternoon went on ration fatigue then went up to Firing Line relieved the 29th Batt
Entry.50: In trench very quiet good dug-outs.
Entry.51:
Same as previous day night time 
was home
 went out in No Mans Land on Patrol
Entry.52: In trenchs still Shifted from No 5 Post to No 4 did trench sentry duty very quiet.
Entry.53: Gas sent over early morning heavy machine gun fire day break two casualities during night quiet day relieved & night by 10th Rifle Brigade
Entry.54:
Arrived Bapaume about eight

o’clock rested all day went pictures night
Entry.55:
Had a rest all 
day
 morning afternoon did Regimental guard for six hours.
Entry.56: Rested all day nightime fell in for Church Parade in Cinema Concert by 48th Division Band afterwards
Entry.57: Dull in morning afternoon went to Fremicourt for bath nothing doing Nightime went to Pictures
Entry.59:
Fatigue all day went down to Bazentin on A.L.R. 
for
 went up on top of the Butte we Wartencourt loaded wire for Fremacourt finished & night came back to Bapaume and shifted out into tents.
Entry.62:
Practising 
all
 company attack morning afternoon band performance by brigade band
Entry.63: Morning church parade then dismissed night time attended Church Service Cinema Hall to her Chaplain General Gurynne and 20th Div. Band
Entry.64:
Usual work
 Instruction in firing live grenades morning and afternoon fired two rifle grenades.
Entry.65:
Mess orderly off dull morning afternoon fatigue

Wednesday6th

Fatigue putting up barbed wire outside of Bapaume
Entry.68: Route march morning afternoon went for bath.
Entry.70: Fell in for an hour in morning afternoon did company drill pictures & night.
Entry.72: Rehearsed counter attack also attack on strong point
Entry.73: Company drill in morning rehearsed a stunt afternoon nightime went to pictures
Entry.74: Had a stunt practice in morning afternoon nothing
Entry.75: Moved out of Bapaume by train arrived Asheaup about seven marched to Senilis Billited there
Entry.76:
and 31st Battalions also there

Sunday 17th

Went to Verannes and Aching for walk
Entry.77: Four hours route march in morning afternoon nothing
Entry.78: Drill and route march in morning.
Entry.79: Moved out of Senilis for Aveling arrived about ten did practice stunt afternoon got paid 60 francs
Entry.80: Did stunt with live ammunition morning moved back to Senilis afternoon
Entry.81:
Usual
 drill Bomb throwing morning and evening

SaturdayJune
Entry.82:
Fatigue all day

Sunday24th

Fell in for church parade morning afternoon went to Warloy Benoux and Flanvillers arrived back got about to pack up go to seaside for rest
Entry.83: Arrived rest camp St. Valery a seven o’clock did nothing all day only walk about
Entry.84:
Fell in morning muster parade dismissed straight away visited villages of PPende and Drancourt and St Valery. Wednesday 27-

Visited Drancourt again had dinner then returned to St. Valery
Entry.85:
After parade went across to village of Le 
Crostnay
 Crotnay poured and had to remain there till tide went out again went to Cinema returned to camp one o’clock in morning
Entry.86: Muster parade had a look round village -
Entry.87: Went to city of Abbeville on leave had a bonzer time returning to camp about ten & night
Entry.88:
July 1at

Afternoon went to Leehiers Coyeux and New Brighton had a good time.
Entry.89: Fell in as usual muster parade -
Entry.90: Fell in as usual afterwards had a swim
Entry.91: Went to Abbeville for a day had a good time.
Entry.92: Fell in warned for guard following day.
Entry.94: Came off guard went to Abbeville had a good day
Entry.95: Moved out of Chest Camp morning left Faint Valery station half past two arrived Albert six o’clock marched out and joined Battalion again & Lenlist.
Entry.96: Morning attended a machine gun lecture washed equipment for inspection by Colonel for following day
Entry.97: Inspected by the Colonel in the morning also had a Retrospective nightime guard in Transport Lines.
Entry.98: Came off guard six o’clock morning then went to Amiens for the day came home by motor lorry & night.
Entry.99: Went to Divisional sports & Herieancourt Sports attended by the King for about an hour marched back in afternoon
Entry.101: Fatigue filling in trenches morning and afternoon
Entry.102: Church parade in morning afternoon went for walk to Warloy came back got paid forty francs.
Entry.103:
When
 Went on a days leave to Amiens had a good time
Entry.104: Went on a route march to Corbie passed through villages of Millincourt Ribbmont Heilly Boundy arrived Corbie midday camped out & La Neuville for night.
Entry.105:
A
 Brigade marched back from Corbie same route as previous day left 8-15 arrived Senlis about midday

did town picket for three hours same night.
Entry.106: Birthday. On fire picket all day /
Entry.107: Went on Dental parade in morning afternoon went to Albert. /
Entry.108: Morning live bomb throwing afternoon physical drill.
Entry.109:
Church parade in morning afternoon went for a walk to Aerodrome.

Monday 23rdBomb throwing morning afternoon got hit 
at
 got anti-tetanus injection
Entry.111: Bomb throwing morning afternoon went to Dentist
Entry.112: Had a days leave to Amiens
Entry.115:
Fell in morning had

Friday 27th

Had a stunt out till afternoon

Saturday 28th

Gas inspector inspections and iron rations morning afternoon had a bath.
Entry.116: Nothing doing preparing to move to Flanders
Entry.117:
Cooks fatigue morning moved out of Seviles seven o’clock for Aveling Wood 
out
 entrained and left & 12 o’clock
Entry.118: In train all night passed through Amiens Abbeville Bordogno, Calais arrived and detrained Saint-Omer then marched to Ragueniem arrived afternoon
Entry.119: Had a teeth inspection morning paid forty francs afternoon rained all day
Entry.120: Route march in Morning afternoon went to Aire
Entry.121: Lecture in morning rained nearly all day.
Entry.122: Morning platoon drill afternoon went to Prectoire.
Entry.123: Nothing doing went to Arques in afternoon – looking for relations
Entry.124: Had a days leave went to St Omer.
Entry.125: Brigade route march late afternoon gas lecture
Entry.126: Bomb throwing in morning afternoon off
Entry.128: Fire picket in morning afternoon went to Bleraniem for bath and change of clothes
Entry.129: Battalion route march in morning afternoon off
Entry.133: Usual drill in morning paid forty francs afternoon
Entry.136:
as previous day got pass to Blighty

Left Praqueniem for Eblingham got on train there arrived Boulogne six o’clock camped there that night
Entry.137:
Left camp seven o’clock in morning got aboard leave boat after very rough trip arrived Folkestone 
Avo

twelve arrived London four
Entry.138: Saw Changing Guard St James palace morning afternoon Hyde Park night time had a look round.
Entry.139: Went out to Hampstead Heath for the day visited High Gate night spent in Bow Street Goal
Entry.140:
Liberated morning afternoon went 
to
 around city visited United Service Museum

Left that night for Edinburgh in Flying Dutchman
Entry.141: Arrived Edinburgh about half past eight visited Holyrood Palace John Knox house Castle. Nelsons Monument Museum. St Giles Cathedral
Entry.142: Went out afternoon to Port Seton with friend
Entry.143: Met friend afternoon went to Zoo that night went out for night.
Entry.144: Went to Braid Hills afternoon night time came back to London ten o’clock train.
Entry.145: Arrived London morning had a look round night time went to Garrick Theatre
Entry.146: Visited Tower London and St Pauls Cathedral nightime went to Lyceum Theatre
Entry.147: Saw changing of the guard had a look round the city
Entry.148: Had a look round city afternoon went to Palladium Theatre
Entry.149: Missed train for France afterwards saw medals distributed by General French afternoon visited St Pauls Cathedral and East End of London
Entry.150:
Left London by eight o’clock train arrived Folkestone ten o’clock left for Boulogne twelve had an awful rough trip sea sick all the way

Arrived Boulogne four o’clock left there ten & night for Battalion
Entry.151: Arrived back & Battalion early morningrested all day
Entry.152: Usual drill morning an hours drill in afternoon
Entry.155: Morning bomb-throwing afternoon and night town-picket.
Entry.156: Went Blaringham in morning for walk gas lecture afternoon
Entry.157: Afternoon went on a stint morning dull.
Entry.159: Stunt with another battalion all morning afternoon off after tea went to D.P. Blaringham
Entry.160:
Same as previous day
 Leave to At Omer.
Entry.162: Stunt in morning afternoon paid forty francs
Entry.165: Morning instruction in bomb-throwing afternoon issued with iron rations
Entry.166:
Marched out of 
Ranqueham
 Raquiniem full marching order arreived Stienvoordie sixteen miles & sunset
Entry.167: Left Steenvourde morning marched to camp near Piperinghe Belgium
Entry.168: Usual drill that night went for a walk to Abeele
Entry.169: Went up to have a look at a model of ridge to be attacked shortly nightime went to Poperingtle
Entry.170: Usual drill in morning instructions in Stokes Mortars afternoon one hours drillSaturday
Entry.173: Marched out late in afternoon for front line arrived and camped near Dickybush about nine & night
Entry.174:
Left camp at

Rested during day left about ten & night for front line for a hop .
Entry.175:
Attacked the German trenches Polygon Wood about day light gained all objectivities enemy counter attacked on the right late in afternoon he got driven back with heavy casualities aeroplane brought down by our infantry late in afternoon 
afternoon
 fairly quiet during night time.
Entry.176:
Dug in and laid low all day very heavy bombardment & dusk got relieved by 32nd battalion eight o’clock

went back and stayed & B.H.Q.
Entry.177: Remained at B.H.Q. all day enemy shelled fairly heavy some casualities
Entry.178: In same position till three o’clock then got relieved arrived back near Dickebush about seven and camped
Entry.179: Rested all day had a muster roll call about fifty per cent casualities.
Entry.180: Left Dickebush one o’clock marched to Wippenhook arrived about five same afternoon
Entry.181: Addressed and congratulated by Colonel on good work the Battalion did in the stunt
Entry.184: Nothing in the morning afternoon route march.
Entry.185: Usual drill in morning afternoon went to Bailleul
Entry.187:
Marched out of camp to near Poperilnghe then got into Motor Lorries and went 
to
 close to Ypres through Vlameringhe got out of lorries and marched over to Huts.
Entry.188:
Left camp about eight

o’clock for Parschendale front line relieved 8th Batt. About midday.
Entry.189: Still in support trenches went for rations in afternoon
Entry.190: Still in trench went on fatigue late Afternoon
Entry.192: Carried iron stakes up to support early morning returned midday by 57th Batt. Arrived back & Huts about dark
Entry.193: Moved back and camped & Palace Camp
Entry.194:
Had a parade shortages taken bath and change of clothes in evening nightime went to pictures@ 
Themineghelst
 Reninghelst
Entry.195: Cooks fatigue morning nightime went to Reninghelst to Concert by Kookaburras
Entry.196:
Saw large enemy aeroplane brought to ground in morning

afternoon moved 
out to
 up to Preserve line
Entry.197: Did fatigue work digging road drain in morning afternoon moved back to Froan Area
Entry.198: In camp all day nothing doing
Entry.200: Afternoon moved off to front line arrived there & 8-30 relieved 56th Batt.
Entry.201: Trenches kept low all day went ration fatigue & night
Entry.202: Still in trenches went out covering party & night for wiring party.
Entry.203: Same as previous day miserable day ration fatigue@ night
Entry.204: Still the same relieved & night by 58th arrived half way house
Entry.205: Left half way house half past one arrived and camped & Halifax Camp for night
Entry.206:
Escort in 
per
 morning afternoon had a bath nightime pictures
Entry.207:
Church parade in morning pictures & night

Sun
 Monday 
28
Entry.208: Went on prisoners escort to Bailliue got in train Poperinghe went through Hazeibrouck arrived Bailliue dusk camped & 23 Rue De :a Gare
Entry.209: Got prisoners left Bailliue two o’clock arrived Peperinghe half past six marched back to Halfway camp arrived about eight o’clock.
Entry.214: Church parade in morning pictures & night.
Entry.215: Moved out of Halifax Camp arrived Wippenvock one o’clock
Entry.218: Bomb lecture in morning one hours drill in afternoon
Entry.219: Usual drill morning afternoon route march nightime cooker guard
Entry.220: Had a days leave went to Bailliue rainy day
Entry.221: Marched out of camp for line arrived and camped in huts & Locre for night
Entry.222: Detailed for a job of guarding enemy prisoners & No 1 Cage & Bailleue arrived here about ten got leave to Bailleue evening
Entry.223:
Fell in for parade morning also medical inspection

ordered Hospital by the Doctor
Entry.224: Went to C.C.S.G.S. stayed there that day and night
Entry.225: Left Bailleue in Hospital train 23 arrived Wimmeranx six left in Ambulance for 25 General Hospital
Entry.226: Sick parade got three days treatment
Entry.227: Did nothing during day nightime went to pictures
Entry.229: Went to Doctor got three days treatment
Entry.230: Did nothing during day nightime went to concert
Entry.232: Went to doctor got treatment and three days fatigue.
Entry.235: Went to Dr again got three days treatment
Entry.236: Did nothing during day nightime went to pictures
Entry.237: Nothing doing went to concert & night.
Entry.238: Went to Doctormorning got two days treatment and fatigue
Entry.239: Fatigue in morning in linen stores
Entry.240: Went to Doctor in morning got three days treatment
Entry.243: Went to Dr morning got three days treatment
Entry.244: Fatigue carrying patients to operating theatre all morning concert & night
Entry.245: Went to Doctor in morning got another three days different treatment
Entry.248: Marked out by Colonel got uniform again left in Ambulance afternoon for Marlbourough Details camp arrived there dusk went down to Boulogne & night.
Entry.249: Fatigue in morning & sanitary section in Boulogne visited Boulogne & night
Entry.250: Fatigue Ostrove Camp all day night time went Boulogne
Entry.251: Warned for draft for Base morning went for route march afternoon and night went to Boulogne.
Entry.252:
Left Details camp morning for Boulogne

for base travelled all day and night
Entry.253: Arrived Harfleur daylight sick all day
Entry.254: Visited Doctor nothing doing. Shifted camp afternoon
Entry.255:
Nothing doing during morning 
nightime
 afternoon issued with new clothes
Entry.256: Went to Le Havre afternoon and night
Entry.257: Wen through gas in morning nightime went to Le Havre
Entry.258: Went to Bull ring in morning afternoon paid forty francs
Entry.260:
Left base two ’clock marched to Le Havre

entrained there got out of train midnight & Rouen
Entry.261:
Still 
hav
 & Rouen got 2½ hours leave in town visited Museum. Joan of Arc Memmorial place also oldest clock in the world entrained again four o’clock
Entry.262: Arrived and detrained Etaples morning visited cemetery left again eleven arrived & Qamer next camp late & night
Entry.263: Arrived back and joined Battalion & Devsieys
Entry.264: No drill had a look round
Entry.265: Nothing doing had a good Christmas dinner
Entry.270: Fell in for church parade no parade went Boulogne evening
Entry.271:
Morning cleaned equipment went for a bath got paid forty francs afternoon

New Year Day 1918

Sick nearly all day
Entry.273: Left Derres went to Famer Div Platoon drilled flevions
Entry.275: Drilled in morning afternoon went for a bath and change of clothes
Entry.276: Had a rest all day went to bed feeling crook
Entry.277: Usual Platoon drill morning boxing and football afternoon
Entry.278: Drill for a while then bomb lecture
Entry.284: Bayonet drill and bomb lecture in morning afternoon recreation
Entry.286: Left Lamer and rejoined unit & Derres paid 40 francs afternoon
Entry.287: Went up to rifle range in morning and came back rained and snowed all morning
Entry.290: Voluntary church parade morning bathing parade after
Entry.293: Brigade marched past General Birdwood in morning & Devres
Entry.295: Hat orderly afternoon repetition by Div General
Entry.296: Drill in morning afternoon went to Boxing
Entry.298: Came off guard nine o’clock went on kit inspection
Entry.299: Paraded morning full marching order afternoon fatigue.
Entry.300: Marched out of Derres 3-45 in morning arrived Famer about seven entrained and left about eleven arrived & Neuve Eglise six marched to Billets
Entry.301: Met relation in 17th Batt Detailed off for engineers fatigue camped & Lindenhouk camp for night in canteen
Entry.302: Left Lindenhouk for job arrived Bells Dump dusk
Entry.303: Detailed off for gas guard & night went for mail in morning
Entry.307: Went for Bath in morning nightime gas guard
Entry.309: Went to Kemmel for mail in morning night time went up to supports building support trench
Entry.310: Went up to support line working on trench
Entry.312: Went on a new sector working on strong post
Entry.313: Went out again doing same as previous day
Entry.318:
Went to Kemmel for mail in morning nightime 
carri
 went up carrying flying pigs from Messines up through Hans Walk to Pill Box near line
Entry.323:
Went into Kemmel to se

Battalion in morning nightime digging another strong post
Entry.324: Still digging strong post very muddy
Entry.325: Went into Kemmel to see mates nightime rest and warned for Paris leave
Entry.326: Left Messines for Kemmel got pass for Paris left Bailleue arrived Calais afternoon left Calais seven o’clock for Paris
Entry.327: Arrived Paris early morning Went to Hotel W Bank during day walked round city nightime went to Alhambra Music Hall good show
Entry.328: Walking round city again, beautiful place nightime went to Folly Bergere tip top show
Entry.329: Bad day went out Y.M.C.A. trip Visited. Phaeton Gallery Cluny Museum Notre Dame nightime went to Casino nee Paris
Entry.331:
Walking round Boulevard all day nightime pictures

Saturday 30th 

Visited Palace of Versailles rotten day
Entry.332: Wet day nightime visited Grand Opera Faust afternoon Invalides
Entry.333: Rained all day promenarded Boulevards all day
Entry.334:
Dull day 
f
 cleared up afterwards walked round city for last time left

eleven forty that night for Calais
Entry.335: Arrived Calais eleven thirty left in train for Hazerbroulk arrived there and changed into train for Bailleul arrived & B.H.Q. dusk
Entry.336: Went out to fatigue job again in morning nightime went out wiring strong post
Entry.339: Lovely weather night time went out carrying to near front line
Entry.340: Days rest went in and saw mates & Prossignel Camp Kemmel
Entry.341: Visited Dr wrenched ankle light Duty gas guard & night
Entry.342: Still glorious weather saw escaped balloon brought down night time usual work making strong posts
Entry.344: Went to Kemmel to see mates nightime working strong post one man killed couple wounded
Entry.345: Shelled out of dug-outs by enemy went into Kemmel nightime usual work
Entry.349: Went for bath in morning rained no work & night
Entry.350:
Went up & nightime to finish a 
du
 strong point
Entry.351: Afternoon went to work with engineers building new dug-outs
Entry.352: On same job again went to pictures & night.
Entry.353: Went out on wiring party & nightime.
Entry.354: Holiday as usual got orders to get iron rations for a move saw relation in 17th Batt
Entry.355: Moved out got into Motor Lorries passed through several villages including Abelle got shelled got out of bus then marched to Metian
Entry.356:
Got in train & Gode Wareneselde left there & night

arrived Doullerrs next morning & eight o’clock
Entry.357: Left Doullens – marched 14 miles through Orville and several other villages traffic on roads very busy arrived and camped@ Betrancourt & night.
Entry.358: Left Betrancourt in rain in morning marched to Bus then drafted out to neucleus camped that night & Army Camp School.
Entry.359:
Left Corps School 
eig
 Division neucleus marched through several villages and camped that night & Le Souchie
Entry.360: Left Le Soucihie marched through Frevant and several more places to Flers camped there for night
Entry.361: Had a day off went to Frevent afternoon
Entry.362:
Had a days leave to Frevant

Wednesday April 2nd

Same old thing
Entry.363: Left Flers full marching order passed through Flevant and camped & Bonnieres
Entry.364: On wood fatigue for cooks afternoon went to Frevan had a good night
Entry.365: Left Bonnieres in morning marched in drill order to Fienvillers arrived about two
Entry.366:
Had a day off visited aerodrome morning and night afternoon went to 
/
 Candas
Entry.367: Went to Doctor in morning afterwards day off
Entry.368: Had drill morning and afternoon nightime went to pictures & Aerodrome
Entry.369: Morning physical drill bayonet etc afternoon rifle shooting.
Entry.370: Same as previous day nightime went to Pictures
Entry.371: Marched out of Fierinellers passed through Domart visited Brucamps midday
Entry.373: Day off went into Domelit Afternoon
Entry.376: Wood Fatigue afternoon went to St Ouen
Entry.378: Shooting and dummy stunt evening went to
Entry.380: Marched out of Brucamps through St Leger Belraneous to Pernois had a swim on arrival
Entry.383: as previous day got boots back.
Entry.384: Grenade firing in Morning afternoon Sports went to St Vouen
Entry.385: Anzac Day Divisional Sports day off
Entry.386: Paid thirty Francs in morning afternoon bomb throwing
Entry.388: Church parade morning rest of day nothing
Entry.394: Dentist and Dr marked Hospital couldnt get one all drill
Entry.396: Morning machine gun loading after stunt live ammunition one man killed one wounded
Entry.397: Machine gun instruction morning and afternoons
Entry.398: Morning and afternoon firing with machine gun on rifle range
Entry.399: Morning shooting with Lewis gun afternoon gun drill and football
Entry.400: Morning P.T. and bayonet drill afternoon Football
Entry.401:
31st Batt drawn game paid 40 Francs. Saturday

Drill morning went to Sanaples evening
Entry.402: Went to Mass R.C.Church afternoon went to Vignacourt
Entry.405: Went for a bath in morning details went up to line night time went to pictures
Entry.407: Same as previous day warned to go to line
Entry.408: Cooks fatigue morning afternoon went to Corps sports and to St Ouen.
Entry.409: Left Pernos ten o’clock arrived near aerodrome two very hot went to Bertangles
Entry.410: Continued march through Cardonette. Allonville arrived Buzzy about two bombed & night.
Entry.411: Left Buzzy in morning arrived & House line stayed till six moved on and joined unit that night in front line
Entry.414: Went out as covering party in No Mans Land for raid on German outpost raid a failure three men killed seven wounded.
Entry.415: Trenches all day digging at night
Entry.421: In trenches all day nightime patrol /
Entry.422: Same old thing relieved & night by 50th Battalion Split marched all night
Entry.423: Marched till dinner time then billeted in big empty Hospital outside Amiens suburb Privery
Entry.425: Parade and two hours fatigue in morning paid thirty Francs afternoon
Entry.426: Usual company drill morning afternoon swim
Entry.427: Physical jerks and swim in morning afternoon change of clothes
Entry.430: Nothing doing morning had a look through city goal afternoon swimming
Entry.431: Machine gun shooting near old fort
Entry.432: Shooting and instruction in Lewis gun again came home and shifted from Rivery to next village in shelters.
Entry.434: Came off guard in morning paid forty francs rested all day
Entry.435: Left camp two o’clock in lorries for trenches left Cowis & Pont-Noyelles then marched to trenches relieved
Entry.437:
Usual trench duties no poses

In trenches until
Entry.439: Relieved early morning by 56th Battalion came back to La Hoyose line in dug outs –
Entry.440: Nothing during day nightime went up towards line laying cable.
Entry.441: Sick all day did nothing nightime went to Benecourt
Entry.443:
Training for raid route march afternoon raid 
cas
 off
Entry.444: Machine gun lecture afternoon nightime fatigue laying cable.
Entry.450:
Bath in 
moming
 morning

Stand too & night also cooker guard.
Entry.451: Machine gun lecture and gas lecture
Entry.452: Usual days with machine gun instruction fatigue & nightime laying cable.
Entry.454: Same as usual two balloons brought down near trench
Entry.455: Machine gun competition in morning team came second
Entry.456: Gun lecture in morning afternoon training for a raid
Entry.457: Training for raid in morning afternoon football
Entry.458:
D
 Training in morning afternoon had a swim nightime moved out for reserve line arrived trenches & Beure returned 57th Battalion good dug-outs
Entry.459: In trenches nothing doing reserve front line several casualities two killed one man one officer
Entry.460: Birthday still in trenches very quiet.
Entry.462: Nothing during day nightime short water fatigue C Coy raided by English And Australians one killed our side six on theirs several casualities - our trench mistaken for enemy.
Entry.463: Nothing during day nightime went up to front line then on patrol –
Entry.464: Ten o’clock A.M. raid by Yanks and Tommies in daylight stood too for it. Nightime on listeningson
Entry.465:
Same as day before patrol & night.

July 25th

Same again went out in No Mans Land looking for body of dead German for indentification, relieved midnight by 2nd London Fusiliers. Marched back to Ballarat line.
Entry.466: In trenches all day nightime went up to front line carrying stoles mortars bombs for hop over 8th -
Entry.467: Brigades hopped over midnight look 600 yards casualities reported light - best mate killed.
Entry.471: Moved out & nightime to tenches farther back. Querioux.
Entry.472: Went into Rivery for swim tanks moving everywhere
Entry.473: In dug outs. Heavy traffic on roads
Entry.475:
again.

moved out & night camped in reserve line for big stunt
Entry.478:
In trenches all day wet day waiting for offensive to start

August 
6
Entry.479: In trenches moved out 12-30 for front line for stunt
Entry.480:
Hop over
 Heavy fog Went over & 5-20 in dense fog gained all objectives eleven o’clock advanced about seven miles passed villages of Warfussic Bayonvillers and Harboniers.

Casualities very light remained in old 
dug out
 trench for the day and night. Big gun taken by 31st
Entry.481: In trench one company went over again@ eleven second Div went through afternoon and gained objectives, enemy shelled a bit stronger.
Entry.482: Came out of trenches marched down to near Davuis
Entry.485: Still in same place nightime went over to Bussy to concert by the 3rd Div party The Coo-ooes
Entry.488: Shifted out in afternoon to avoid reserve brigade to the Division arrived sun down met an old townmate
Entry.489: Nothing doing enemy shelled a bit
Entry.490:
Machine gun lecture in

morning afternoon went into Bayon-Villers
Entry.492: Same again went to Bayon-Villers afternoon
Entry.493: Came out to near Davours afternoon very hot day
Entry.494: Nothing doing all day Went to Davours for swim nightime to Bussy.
Entry.495: Did nothing went to Davours during day.
Entry.496: Marched up to front line arrived about eleven o’clock returned 5th Battalion A.I.F.
Entry.497: In dug-out all day enemy shelled heavy
Entry.498:
Advanced after enemy rested in old trenches then went through 30th Batt. Came in contact with 
enemy 

enemy lost direction halted for the night few casualities
Entry.499: Continued advance daylight walked several Kilos stayed in trench on a ridge for about an hour then advanced & the toot to Somme river very heavy machine gun fire also direct whizz bang fire some casualities two killed A boy
Entry.500: Stayed in same position all day Fritz planes continually coming over. Had enough for day
Entry.501: Same place all day built foot bridge across Somme returned & night by 32nd Div
Entry.502: In dug-outs in rear all day.
Entry.503: Left to go forward camped in old trench running through village of Halle
Entry.506: Moved out & night time to another sector on left Plenty mustard gas about.
Entry.507: Same trench all day nigh time moved out to advance marched through Peronne enemy gassed Peronne while marching through
Entry.508: Moved off behind 32nd Div went forward about three miles halted for day and night in village of St Gien
Entry.509:
Continued advance daylight went through 32nd Div near Esprees went on about

eight kilos dug in near ravine some shelling during day nine caasualities in Battalion One man killed in eight
Entry.510: Afternoon marched forward about kilo dug in litte shelling casualities in B Coy
Entry.511: Same place all day rained & night fairly quiet
Entry.512: Still in same place relieved & night by 51st Batt A.I.F. came back to old trench near Doignt.
Entry.513: Built posies had a clean up.
Entry.515: Nothing doing went to Doignt nightime
Entry.516: Fatigue washing limbers morning afternoon nothing
Entry.517: Nothing doing went into Peronne & nightime.
Entry.518: Dentist morning and evening nightime went to Doignt to concert given by Coo-ees.
Entry.520:
Machine gun 
le
 firing in morning
Entry.524: Route march in morning after stretcher carring C.C.S. & Doight
Entry.525: Church parade in morning nightime went to hear lecture by Norwood Y.M.C.A.
Entry.526: Morning bayonet fighting and physical jerks afternoon Brigade Sports.
Entry.527: Morning Battalion route march afternoon went to Doight warned for the line
Entry.528:
Went to Dentist

Usual morning drill
Entry.530: Afternoon marched out Neucleus to Divisional Wing went into Peronne Batt went up to line for hop over
Entry.532: Nothing in morning afternoon went to C.C.S. and for a bath ---
Entry.533: Went to Dentist in morning afternoon to C.P.S.
Entry.536: Left Wing after dinner to join Batt got in Anzac Railway & Doignt arrived Roisel and joined Batt at Dusk
Entry.541:
8

Got pass for Blighty

Tuesday 9th

Left Prossiel three o’clock in morning in motors left Chapulette train arrived Boulogne eight o’clock camped & Vadors Rest Billet for night
Entry.542:
In billets all morning afternoon walked around Boulogne.

Thursday 11Oth

Same thing again
Entry.543: Left Rest Billet 9 o’clock boat left Boulogne eleven arrived Folkstone 1-30 arrived London four in night stayed Y.M.C.A. Holborn
Entry.544: Had look round city nightime went to Hackney to movie theatre stayed & Aldridge Y.M.C.A.
Entry.545: Morning went to Petticoat Lane afternoon went out to Hampstead Heath.
Entry.546: Had a look around London nightime Alambra Theatre
Entry.547: Same again went out to Richmond afternoon nightime went to pictures London Opera House caught train for Glasgow
Entry.548: Arrived Glasgow nine o’clock afternoon went to factory nightime to Alambra
Entry.549:
Had a look around city

in morning afternoon went to shell factory.
Entry.550: Central Fire Station afternoon went to Barlay Curle Co Shipbuilding yards on Clyde
Entry.551: Had a look Municipal Bldgs in morning afternoon
Entry.552: Went out to Queens’s Park and Rukand Glen.
Entry.553:
Left Glasgow 9 o’clock arrived Edinburgh 10 o’clock had a look around city

nightime went to Empire Theatre.
Entry.554: Went to castle in morning had a look round city again during day left 9-30 & night for London.
Entry.555: Arrived London eight o’clock afternoon went through old places Staples Inn Old Courts The Old Curiosity shop nightime went to see Yes Uncle & Shaftsbury Theatre
Entry.556: Went different places in city nightime Hippodrome
Entry.557: Missed boat train morning day in London nightime went out to Hyde Park
Entry.558: Left London in morning arrived & Dover got in boat for Boulogne arrived France & night
Entry.560: Left Camp early in morning got in train got out Abbeville marched out to Div Wing got pass to Abbeville
Entry.561: Left Wing in morning to join unit arrived & Villeroy and joined unit afternoon.
Entry.562: Inspection by Div General in morning afternoon went to Oisement
Entry.565: Illustration of company then battalion in attack.
Entry.566: Church parade in morning afternoon went to Oisement
Entry.568: Wet Day cleaning machine gun magazines
Entry.570: Machine gun instruction morning afternoon went to Oisement to Div Paymaster
Entry.571: Machine gun fire morning afternoon sports afternoon
Entry.572: Inspection of machine gun and parts in morning afternoon Brigade sports
Entry.573: Church parade in morning then went to Blangy
Entry.574: Nothing in morning news of hostilities ceasing received night time went to Concert Oisement in honor of it.
Entry.575:
Usual drill 
str
 raining all day 

Wednesday 13th

Parade by Battalion for
 photos.

Thursday
 Tuesday 12th

Usual drill in morning
 Battalion parade for photos
Entry.576: Inspection and march past before Brigadier
Entry.578:
Parade in morning paid forty 
francs
 & night
Entry.579: Route March in morning went to Oisemont & night
Entry.580: Brigade Church Parade addressed by Divisional General told going forward to German frontier went to Aberville evening
Entry.581: No parade told off fer permanent Battalion guard for Germam garrison duty
